## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 435, 875, 632]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non-exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 664, 216, 679]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[95, 680, 732, 712]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 50.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 75, 94, 92]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 107]]<|/det|> At a summer camp an arithmetic test is taken by 250 children. The times taken, to the nearest minute, to complete the test were recorded. The results are summarised in the table. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[163, 116, 875, 163]]<|/det|>
Time taken, in minutes1 - 3031 - 4546 - 6566 - 7576 - 100
Frequency2130688645
<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 178, 148, 196]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 178, 539, 196]]<|/det|> Draw a histogram to represent this information. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 178, 920, 196]]<|/det|> [4] <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[243, 260, 833, 610]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 644, 148, 662]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 644, 532, 662]]<|/det|> State which class interval contains the median. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 644, 920, 662]]<|/det|> [1] <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 788, 146, 806]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 787, 920, 821]]<|/det|> Given that an estimate of the mean time is 61.05 minutes, state what feature of the distribution accounts for the median and the mean being different. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 803, 920, 821]]<|/det|> [1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[109, 303, 920, 336]]<|/det|>
The distributions of the weights of male and female leopards are independent of each other. A male leopard and a female leopard are each chosen at random.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 349, 146, 367]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 348, 784, 367]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that both the weights of these leopards are less than \(46\mathrm{kg}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 349, 920, 367]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 74, 94, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>5</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 603, 92]]<|/det|>
A group of 12 people consists of 3 boys, 4 girls and 5 adults.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 106, 146, 123]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 104, 920, 139]]<|/det|>
In how many ways can a team of 5 people be chosen from the group if exactly one adult is included?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 120, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 364, 186, 381]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 361, 920, 395]]<|/det|>
In how many ways can a team of 5 people be chosen from the group if the team includes at least 2 boys and at least 1 girl?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 380, 920, 397]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 473, 92]]<|/det|>
The same group of 12 people stand in a line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 104, 920, 138]]<|/det|>
How many different arrangements are there in which the 3 boys stand together and an adult is at each end of the line?

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 119, 920, 136]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[76, 73, 92, 92]]<|/det|>
<label>6</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 73, 920, 123]]<|/det|>
A factory produces chocolates in three flavours: lemon, orange and strawberry in the ratio \(3:5:7\) respectively. Nell checks the chocolates on the production line by choosing chocolates randomly one at a time.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 135, 146, 153]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 135, 920, 170]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that the first chocolate with lemon flavour that Nell chooses is the 7th chocolate that she checks.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 151, 920, 168]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 325, 146, 344]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 325, 920, 359]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that the first chocolate with lemon flavour that Nell chooses is after she has checked at least 6 chocolates.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 343, 920, 361]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 516, 920, 551]]<|/det|>
'Surprise' boxes of chocolates each contain 15 chocolates: 3 are lemon, 5 are orange and 7 are strawberry.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 562, 920, 596]]<|/det|>
Petra has a box of Surprise chocolates. She chooses 3 chocolates at random from the box. She eats each chocolate before choosing the next one.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 609, 146, 626]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 609, 734, 626]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that none of Petra's 3 chocolates has orange flavour.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 609, 920, 626]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 148, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 73, 759, 92]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that each of Petra's 3 chocolates has a different flavour.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 73, 920, 92]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 480, 186, 499]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[158, 479, 920, 514]]<|/det|>
Find the probability that at least 2 of Petra's 3 chocolates have strawberry flavour given that none of them has orange flavour.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 495, 920, 514]]<|/det|>
<mark>[4]

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[428, 74, 569, 92]]<|/det|>
